channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Former Israeli PM talks about the hostage release and Israel's standing in the world
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Ehud Olmert, the former prime minister of Israel, as he reflects on the release of Israeli hostages in Gaza and how the war has affected Israel's standing in the world.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Ehud Olmert, the former prime minister of Israel, as he reflects on the release of Israeli hostages in Gaza and how the war has affected Israel's standing in the world.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Israel celebrates as Hamas releases final Israeli hostages
item.description: Hamas released all 20 of the living Israeli hostages on Monday. In turn, Israel will be releasing nearly 2,000 Palestinian prisoners and detainees as part of the ceasefire agreement.
item.content:encoded: Hamas released all 20 of the living Israeli hostages on Monday. In turn, Israel will be releasing nearly 2,000 Palestinian prisoners and detainees as part of the ceasefire agreement.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: 'We Survived the Night' tells a story of survival and the Indigenous experience
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Julian Brave NoiseCat, an Oscar-nominated filmmaker and writer, about his new book, "We Survived the Night."
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Julian Brave NoiseCat, an Oscar-nominated filmmaker and writer, about his new book, "We Survived the Night."
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Hamas begins releasing final Israeli hostages, President Trump addresses Israel's parliament, White House blames Dems for shutdown layoffs, but they've been central to Trump's agenda.
item.content:encoded: Hamas begins releasing final Israeli hostages, President Trump addresses Israel's parliament, White House blames Dems for shutdown layoffs, but they've been central to Trump's agenda.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Antibiotic resistance study offers good news for bacteria, alarming news for humans
item.description: A new World Health Organization study finds 1 in 6 infections worldwide are resistant to some antibiotics, highlighting a growing threat from drug-resistant bacteria.
item.content:encoded: A new World Health Organization study finds 1 in 6 infections worldwide are resistant to some antibiotics, highlighting a growing threat from drug-resistant bacteria.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: Here's why Trump's promised logging boom faces headwinds
item.description: President Trump is trying to reverse the Clinton era rule that puts 59 million acres of National Forest lands off limits to timber harvest and other development. America's timber industry may not see the boom many conservatives expect.
item.content:encoded: President Trump is trying to reverse the Clinton era rule that puts 59 million acres of National Forest lands off limits to timber harvest and other development. America's timber industry may not see the boom many conservatives expect.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler

item.title: Zone 2 training: Explaining the latest trend in fitness
item.description: Zone 2 training is getting a lot of buzz in the fitness world. But what is it and should you care?
item.content:encoded: Zone 2 training is getting a lot of buzz in the fitness world. But what is it and should you care?
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: New Mexico to become first state to offer free childcare
item.description: New Mexico Gov. Michelle Lujan Grisham says her state will be the first to offer free universal childcare, but critics of the plan say key challenges haven't been addressed.
item.content:encoded: New Mexico Gov. Michelle Lujan Grisham says her state will be the first to offer free universal childcare, but critics of the plan say key challenges haven't been addressed.
item.dc:creator: Taylor Velazquez

item.title: Remembering beloved actress and style icon Diane Keaton
item.description: Actress and style icon Diane Keaton has died at age 79. Known mostly for comedy, the Oscar-winning star of "Annie Hall" had an impressive, wide-ranging resume.
item.content:encoded: Actress and style icon Diane Keaton has died at age 79. Known mostly for comedy, the Oscar-winning star of "Annie Hall" had an impressive, wide-ranging resume.
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: President Trump to address Israel's parliament amid hostage exchange
item.description: Widely credited with sealing the deal on the ceasefire in Gaza, President Trump received the red carpet treatment when he arrived in Israel Monday.
item.content:encoded: Widely credited with sealing the deal on the ceasefire in Gaza, President Trump received the red carpet treatment when he arrived in Israel Monday.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre
